title: Bag Room
rules:
Bag Room

  • Use of the Bag Room is free of charge.
  • Use of the Bag Room is at your own risk.
  • You can pick up and return your bags as many times as you like, but you may not hold up the line when you pick up and return your bag at the same time.
  • If you lose your retrieval token you may not be able to get your bag returned before the end of the festival and there may be costs if we mail the bags later.
  • If you leave bags, you will have to pay to have them be mailed to you.
description: It's free of charge, so use the Bag Room as often as you like. When closed during the night, ask the Registration desk in the hotel lounge to get your stuff.
webDescription:
At some locations at the festival you are not allowed to take large(r) luggage items because of security concerns and in any case: it is easier to enjoy the festival without bulky luggage. So leave your suitcases, weekend bags, backpacks, large cosplay attributes and other bulky or fragile luggage in the Bag Room.

This year, the Bag Room will be situated in the Mystery Room on the fourth floor. Take the elevator from the hotel lounge and the entrance to the Bag Room is at the end of a short corridor immediately to the right. Visitors with weekend bags, backpacks, large cosplay attributes and other bulky or fragile luggage are required to leave these items in the Bag Room.

The gophers in attendance will accept your items and hand you a numbered retrieval token in return. Using the Bag Room is free of charge. You can change your cosplay costume and add purchased items as often as you like. The Bag Room is not open at all times during the festival, please see the exact opening times below. When the Bag Room is closed at night, the doors are locked and you will need to contact the Registration Desk in the hotel lounge if you really need to retrieve your items.

Please close all pockets and fasten any straps on your luggage. Make sure things cannot fall out of or come loose from your luggage. Ask the gopher for tape or extra bags if necessary. Please make everything as easy to handle for the gophers as possible.

Please be on time when picking up your bags on Sunday. And please remember we have house rules for safety reasons; deposit your bags at the Bag Room straight after you arrive at the festival. Security will have to ask you to move along if you do not!

No Lockers

Unfortunately we are unable to offer lockers in the Theaterhotel.

title: Registration Desk
description: Get your entry badge, convention booklets and to buy night bus tickets. When closed you can go to the Bag room for your badge and bus ticket.

title: AnimeCon Quiz
description: The AnimeCon Quiz is back! Can you answer these obscure anime/Japan-related questions?
webDescription: Hosted by several core staff members, we’re going to use Kahoot as our Quiz Sytem, so bring your smartphone. Test your knowledge of all things Japan, whether it's pop-culture, history or recent events.

title: Japan Travel on a Budget
description: Always wanted to travel to Japan, but you don’t want to break the bank?
webDescription:
Our very own Kaj will tell you all about the cheaper side of travel and how you can stay on top of your budget, while still enjoying the finer things in the land of the rising sun.

Onze eigen Kaj vertelt je alles over de goedkopere kant van reizen en hoe je binnen je budget kunt blijven, terwijl je toch geniet van de fijnere dingen in het land van de rijzende zon.

title: Shopping in Japan
description: This lecture delves into shopping in Japan itself, but also making use of online auction sites and middleman services.
webDescription: These days, shopping for things from abroad is only a mouse click away, but the special merchandise can be difficult to obtain. Brought to you Kaj, who also hosts Japan Travel on a Budget, this lecture delves into shopping in Japan itself, while also covering the topic of online auction sites and middleman services.

title: 47 Ronin: A Classic Japanese Story
description: Gerard Jellema will tell you this classic heroic tale from the 18th century and explain a thing or two about these unique kind of warriors.
webDescription:
47 Ronin is a famous story in Japan, not in the least because it happened for real! In the early 18th century, a famous daimyō (warlord) was murdered. His loyal samurai took their time to take revenge, but once they did... it was both brutal and glorious. Gerard Jellema, a storyteller known for his love for old Japanese stories, will tell this tale. It is a classic tale in Japan and it has already been turned into books, plays and movies. Gerard will also explain the background of the story: the culture of the Japanese samurai.

47 Ronin is een beroemd verhaal in Japan, omdat het echt is gebeurd! In het begin van de 18e eeuw werd een beroemde daimyo (krijgsheer) vermoord. Het duurde even voordat zijn trouwe samurai wraak namen, maar toen ze dat eenmaal deden... was het zowel bruut als glorieus. Gerard Jellema, een verhalenverteller die bekend staat om zijn liefde voor oude Japanse verhalen, zal dit verhaal vertellen. Het is een klassiek verhaal in Japan en er zijn al boeken, toneelstukken en films van gemaakt. Gerard zal ook de achtergrond van het verhaal uitleggen: de cultuur van de Japanse samurai.

title: Stranger Things: Japan's Strangest Stories
description: Gerard Jellema, a storyteller known for his love of Japanese culture, will be telling you some of the weirdest stories he could find.
webDescription:
Japan is a land full of strange stories. Stories about ghosts, magical creatures, strange happenings... Gerard Jellema, a connaisseur of old Japanse culture, will tell you some of his strangest stories. Have you ever heard of a rokuro-kobi, the vampire-like creature with the unusually long neck? Or the ame-kai yurei, the 'candy-eating ghost'?

Japan is een land vol vreemde verhalen. Verhalen over geesten, magische wezens, vreemde gebeurtenissen... Gerard Jellema, een kenner van de oude Japanse cultuur, zal je enkele van zijn vreemdste verhalen vertellen. Heb je ooit gehoord van een rokuro-kobi, het vampierachtige wezen met de ongewoon lange nek? Of de ame-kai yurei, de 'snoep etende geest'?

title: Deshima Sounds
description: An extravagant, annual tradition, Deshima Sounds will return to host a show at AnimeCon Classic!
webDescription: Deshima Sounds is the brain child of long time friends and DJs Neodash Zerox and SuperEuroJimmy. They started to play together back in 2006 at our very own AnimeCon. Unleashing a mix of Japanese pop, hiphop, dance and hardcore music, this became a big success and eventually the two collaborated to start Deshima Sounds in 2008, with the first party held in October of that year. Ever since Deshima Sounds is a well known name in the Dutch scene, with friends all over Europe. Even in Japan a lot of connections have been made and the Deshima Sounds project is supported by big names in the Japanese dance scene!

title: Tea Ceremony
description: In the tea ceremony workshop, visitors will learn about traditional Japanese tea ceremonies.
webDescription:
Ready for a quiet moment of meditation during your busy convention weekend? Would you like to have a taste of traditional Japanese culture? Visit the Japanese tea ceremony by Ambaran Artgroup. You will hear about the type of tea that is used, as well as the rituals that are upheld in a tea ceremony club. You will have a cup of delicious matcha tea, which you will have prepared yourself. Please note, you will not need a separate ticket to participate and instead abide by the ancient law of ‘first come, first served’. 

Ambaran hosts workshops and lectures at anime conventions in the Netherlands, such as the tea ceremony and calligraphy.
http://www.ambaran.nl
https://www.facebook.com/ambaranart

title: Calligraphy
description: In the calligraphy workshop, participants will learn the basic strokes of calligraphy. They will be able to write their name onto a decorative scroll as a final piece of artwork.
webDescription:
Put your artistic skills to good use. Visit the calligraphy workshop, hosted by Ambaran Artgroup (www.ambaran.nl and ambaranart on Facebook). You will learn the basic strokes that are used in Chinese and Japanese calligraphy. At the end of the workshop, you will have the basic skills to create your very own piece of calligraphy artwork. Naturally, you can take your masterpiece home with you! As a special treat, available only at AnimeCon Classic, Ambaran will research how to write your name in the Japanese alphabet and you will be given a beautiful decorative scroll to draw your name onto.

Please be aware, you must sign up at the Registration Desk on the convention grounds in order to participate.

title: Opening Ceremony
description: The festival kicks off! Attend the opening ceremony for all the juicy news and details about our 1st edition of AnimeCon Classic!

title: Closing Ceremony
description: The Closing Ceremony brings our convention to an end on the Main Stage with some final prizes, highlights from the event and more information on our future editions. Please come and express your appreciation for all of our volunteers and sponsors.

title: Venetian Mask Crafting
description: Join this unique workshop to create your own Venetian mask. Give it your own special flavor with the bling that we bring.
webDescription:
When you thought it couldn’t get better, we offer you a chance to add LED lights into your mask! Several colors, a battery and an on/off switch are all included in this complimentary LED package. Don’t miss out on this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!

Core Focus Photography and Custom FX have joined forces to offer you this one of a kind workshop. Don’t worry, we will help you to get the LEDs into your mask, so no prior knowledge of any tech or equipment is required. Let's go and have fun! Tickets will be for sale through the ticket booth.
ticketsInfo:
Linda van der Toorn, corefocusphotography@gmail.com, 06-40045956
Wouter van der Toorn, customfxcreations@gmail.com, 06-40131971

title: Bedazzled: Create a Roaring 20s Headband
description: Create your own flashy Roaring 20s headband in this workshop. Get ready to be dazzled!
webDescription:
Are you ready to join the Roaring Twenties? This workshop has got you covered. You'll get to create your very own 20s-style headband, free of charge! Wear it with your outfit and visit any cool party! Craft it to your liking with the glitz and glam that we bring to the party (yes, this workshop). Get ready to be dazzled!

Beware, only 25 visitors may participate on a first come, first serve basis.

Ben jij klaar om je aan te sluiten bij de Roaring Twenties? Met deze workshop ben je helemaal compleet. Je kunt gratis je eigen hoofdband in jaren '20-stijl maken! Draag hem bij je outfit en ga naar elk gaaf feestje! Maak het naar je eigen smaak met de glitter en glamour die we naar het feest brengen (ja, deze workshop). Maak je klaar om verblind te worden!

Let op, slechts 25 bezoekers mogen deelnemen op basis van wie het eerst komt, het eerst maalt.

title: Posing - The Roaring 20s Way
description: Are you cosplaying as a character from the 1920s? Would you like to learn some of the key poses from models and movie stars from that period? Come and join us on an epic journey into the Roaring 20s!
webDescription:
Are you cosplaying as a character from the 1920s? Would you like to learn some of the key poses from models and movie stars from that period? Or are you interested in learning some new funky poses? This is your chance! Come and join us on an epic journey into the Roaring 20s!

Core Focus Photography will take you back to the time when Al Capone ruled, Bonnie and Clyde were the couple to watch out for and The Charleston was the most popular dance in town.

Poses from the Roaring 20s are a lot different from the poses that we know now. In this lecture we’ll take a look at a lot of different poses and tell you what to look out for when actually trying these poses. Together, we’ll make the old days live again! If you’re interested in our photo shoots, please check out our website www.corefocusphotography.com.

Ben je aan het cosplayen als een personage uit de jaren 1920? Wil je enkele van de belangrijkste poses leren van modellen en filmsterren uit die periode? Of ben je geïnteresseerd in het leren van nieuwe funky poses? Dit is je kans! Kom en ga met ons mee op een epische reis naar de Roaring 20s!

Core Focus Photography neemt je mee terug naar de tijd dat Al Capone regeerde, Bonnie en Clyde het paar waren om op te letten en The Charleston de meest populaire dans in de stad was.

Poses uit de Roaring 20s zijn heel anders dan de poses die we nu kennen. In deze lezing bekijken we veel verschillende houdingen en vertellen we je waar je op moet letten bij het daadwerkelijk uitvoeren van deze poses. Samen maken we de oude tijd weer levend! Als je geïnteresseerd bent in onze fotoshoots, kijk dan op onze website www.corefocusphotography.com.

title: Mystery Hunt: The Blind Pig
description: This is a mystery hunt where you are tasked with finding the identity of an underground mobster. It’s an interactive game spread around the halls of AnimeCon.
webDescription:
AnimeCon City has been taken over by the mafia. Detective O’Malley has been doing everything he can to find out who is behind the recent increase in crimes and arrest the ones responsible. However, he can’t do it alone anymore. Detective O’Malley has sent YOU a letter asking for help to find and arrest the underground mafia boss!

Clues and hints to solve the mystery are hidden in the posters and articles. Walk around the streets (halls) of AnimeCon City and find the necessary information to uncover the true identity of the mafia leader!

No-sign up required. You can participate at any given time during the day before the event ends. At night the mystery hunt will end and the solution will be revealed. If you want to know the solution or simply chill with us, then feel free to come and join! More information regarding the rules and explanation regarding the game, can be found on the poster at AnimeCon, conveniently found in the hotel lobby.

----

Dit is een mystery hunt waar het jou taak is om de identiteit van de maffiabaas te achterhalen. Het is een interactief spel verspreid over de gangen van AnimeCon.

AnimeCon City is overgenomen door de maffia. Detective O’Malley heeft er alles aan gedaan om erachter te komen wie de toename in misdaad heeft veroorzaakt en ze voor het gerecht te brengen. Hij kan het verder niet alleen aan. Detective O’Malley heeft een brief gestuurd om JOU om hulp te vragen met het vinden en arresteren van de maffiabaas!

Alle nodige informatie kan je vinden in de verschillende posters en nieuwsartikelen die hangen in AnimeCon City. Loop door de straten (gangen) van AnimeCon City en verzamel de benodigde informatie om achter de identiteit te komen van de maffiabaas!

Je hoeft je niet op te geven om mee te doen met het evenement. Je kan meedoen gedurende de hele dag wanneer het voor jou uitkomt tot de eindtijd. S’avonds zal er een einde komen aan de Mystery Hunt en de oplossing zal onthult worden. Als je de oplossing wil weten of gewoon met ons wil chillen, kom dan vooral langs! Verdere regels en uitleg over de game zijn te vinden op de poster op AnimeCon, makkelijk te vinden in de hotel lobby.
ticketsInfo:
Amber Huijsmans en Sanne Videler
amber.huijsmans@gmail.com

title: Walk-In Papercrafting
description: Papercraft is the art of making a 3D object from one or more sheet(s) of paper, depending on what you want to make. This workshop will be on a walk-in basis.
webDescription:
Papercraft is the art of making a 3D object from one or more sheet(s) of paper, depending on what you want to make. 'Pepakura' is used by several cosplayers as a base for armor and/or weapons. Unfortunately, there is not nearly enough time in a single workshop to make a whole set of armor, so we will be making a small figure to learn the basics. For those with more experience, there will be a few advanced models available. Stop by whenever you like and see if there's a spot available, because this workshop will be on a walk-in basis.

Papercraft is de kunst om een 3D-object te maken van een of meer vellen papier, afhankelijk van wat je wilt maken. 'Pepakura' wordt door verschillende cosplayers gebruikt als basis voor bepantsering en/of wapens. Helaas is er in een enkele workshop lang niet genoeg tijd om een hele set harnassen te maken, dus we zullen een klein figuurtje maken om de basis te leren. Voor degenen met meer ervaring zullen er enkele geavanceerde modellen beschikbaar zijn. Kom langs wanneer je wilt en kijk of er een plekje vrij is, want deze workshop is op inloopbasis.

title: European Cosplay Gathering Group and Solo preliminaries
rules:
• For cosplay weapons guidelines read the house rules/huisregels. Dutch weapons law will always apply!
  • The Dutch team will be represented by a team of two or three cosplayers (this team must be in costumes from the same series) and a solo contestant.
  • You or your team must wear self-made costumes.
  • You or your team may use small props that were store bought.
  • The team must perform an act on stage that may not exceed 150 seconds; the solo act may not exceed 90 seconds*.
  • Once entered, you will get a script form to fill in the details of your act. This will have to be handed in on Sunday September 4th, 23:59h at the latest.
  • With your script, you will also have to provide: 
    - Work in Progress pictures from all parts of the costume and relevant props, 
    - Reference pictures, 
    - Any audio/video you want to use during the skit.
  • 3D-printing: Somewhere on the final product needs to be an embossment of your makers mark (your initials) as part of the design. Make screenshots during the designing to add to your WiPs.
  • Teams may not use: Any items that can spill on the stage, like bubbles, glitter, confetti etc.
  • Teams may not use: Live fire, dry ice, live steel weapons or other things that could be a danger to yourself or others.
  • Stage ninjas are NOT allowed.
  • You must attend AnimeCon Classic at least on Friday if you want to compete for ECG Group.
  • You must attend AnimeCon Classic at least on Sunday if you want to compete for ECG Solo.
  • You must be 18 years or older on the date of the preliminaries if you want to compete for the ECG.
  • You must be able to come to France in July for the European Cosplay Gathering, which is always from a Wednesday to Monday.
  • Train costs (from the nearest HSL station closest to the winners to Paris) will be paid for by Stichting Japanse Popcultuur, the rest of your costs (food, drink, trips, extra luggage, trip to the train station, etc.) will NOT be covered.
  • Your Cosplay must be from an anime, manga, comic, video game, movie, TV series or J-Music. It may not be from a stage musical or be a Gijinka or fictional character you or your friends created.

*Please note that at the ECG, the solo act has to be 75 seconds max. The representative will have to adjust his/her act in accordance before the finals.
description: You may have heard about Japan-Expo in Paris before, because it's the largest Japanese Pop-culture related event outside of Japan. Ten years ago, they started a Pan-European Costume or Cosplay competition where only the Top 15 European Cosplay countries can compete!
webDescription:
The Netherlands is of course considered as one of these fifteen countries! Japan-Expo, in its wisdom has chosen AnimeCon as the event that will send the Dutch representatives to the European Cosplay Gathering (ECG) at Japan-Expo in July! You as a solo Cosplayer or as a team of two or three people can win an expenses paid trip including hotel rooms to Japan-Expo where you will have to compete and represent The Netherlands at the European Cosplay Gathering and hopefully win fabulous prizes there!

The group contest is held on Friday, the solo contest on Sunday.

title: Clara Cow's Cosplay Cup
reasonInvisible: Waiting on tekst and time confirmation
rules:
• For cosplay weapons guidelines read the house rules.
  • Dutch weapon law will always apply!
  • The team must be in costumes from the same property.
  • The team must wear self-made costumes.
  • The team may use small props that were store-bought.
  • The team must perform an act on stage that may not exceed 180 seconds.
  • Set-up time for props will be 30 seconds MAX.
  • Maximum number of stage props will be 4.
  • Maximum size of stage props is 2mx2m
  • Set up will be by our team and they are NOT allowed to run on stage.
  • Teams may not use: Any items that can spill on the stage, like bubbles, water, fake blood, glitter, confetti etc.
  • Teams may not use: Live fire, dry ice, live steel weapons or other things that could be a danger to yourself or others
  • You must be 18 years or older on September 23rd 2022.
  • Your Cosplay can be from any official (Eastern or Western) animation, comic and game.
  • Fan art cosplay, a fictional character you or your friends created and live action movies are not allowed!
  • Cosplayers may only participate in one preliminary per edition of CCCC
  • Costumes that have participated in finals of international contests cannot be re-used in preliminaries or the finals of CCCC
  • Stage ninjas are NOT allowed, our staff can hand you a prop or item from backstage or press a button for you. Interaction with the cosplayers on stage is NOT allowed.
  • Costume quality counts for 40%
  • Act counts for 60%
  • Bought costumes will be scored 0 for quality and will be disqualified
description:
Hello everyone, welcome to Clara Cow's Cosplay Cup!, the relaxed international cosplay event at AnimeCon.

Even though it's a relaxed event, the prizes you can win are totally awesome!

What we at AnimeCon would like to achieve is that teams of two cosplayers can have a relaxed weekend and then compete in a show that takes a total of four hours out of their day from start to finish. Clara Cow's Cosplay Cup attempts to bring back the fun and bonding between cosplayers of different countries to the international stage. We don’t want to be presumptuous, but we do have a nice prize for the winning team!
webDescription:
Clara Cow's Cosplay Cup will have its sixth round at AnimeCon Classic, Theaterhotel Almelo, The Netherlands in September, 2022. Before that date, preliminary rounds have been held at many events worldwide. 

What is Clara Cow's Cosplay Cup?

The most relaxed international cosplay event currently organized in Europe, with a main prize of a trip to Japan for the winning team with all taxes, hotel and Japan Rail Pass covered!

The CCCC team is currently working on the definite schedule for the event but it will quite probably go as follows:
Thursday: International teams arrive at Schiphol
Friday afternoon: Record introduction movie
Friday evening: Welcome all and meet your new friends (unofficial get together)
Saturday morning: Teams practice
Saturday afternoon: Finals
Saturday evening: Results and Party
Sunday morning: Relaxation
Sunday evening: International teams leave

Why this competition?

We want to organize an event that is more focused on the PLAY side of cosplay, with a 60% judgement on play and a 40% judgement on costume. Aside from this, all official animated, comic (East or West) and game characters can enter the competition. This is a bit different from the existing events where the focus is more towards costumes and Orientally-based characters only. Please note that NO FAN ART characters can enter the competition. Only comic, cartoon and game characters, east or west can take part. So manga, comic, or even European characters are fine. Live action is not.

What makes it so relaxed?

A lot of points that we have found to be taxing on the competing teams have been eliminated to assure a nice and relaxed weekend for everyone competing.

Hotel near the event (with rooms provided for all finalist teams).
Judging will be just before the competition, about two hours before, for the first team.
Backstage area with ice cream, dressing rooms with shower and toilet.
Lunch with all kinds of food and soft drinks, juice and water provided.
English-speaking staff (If you only speak your own language, we will try to get an interpreter for you)
You can use one of the real theatres in Europe for your performance.
You will have a nice big stage to perform on.

Please note that all audio for your act needs to be pre-recorded. Live microphones on stage are not allowed.

Do you have rules for this competition?

Yes, we do! We would like to keep them as simple as possible, but to make sure everything will go as smooth as possible for the judging process and the morning practice and light set up, we require you to read and follow the rules. You can find them in the rules section.

How can we take part?

Please refer to our partner organizations to see when, why, how and what.

  • Belgium: F.A.C.T.S
  • Bulgaria: AnimeS Expo
  • Canada: Otafest 
  • Czech Republic: Animefest
  • Denmark: Genki
  • Finland: Cosvision, Cosplayn SM
  • France: Mang'Azur
  • Germany: Animuc
  • Italy: Romics
  • Malaysia: AniManGaki's AMG-chan
  • Netherlands: AnimeCon
  • Poland: Japanicon
  • Portugal: Iberanime
  • Spain: Salon Del Manga
  • Switzerland: Japan Impact, Lausanne
  • UK: MCM London Comic Con
  • USA: Youmacon

title: Solo Cosplay Competition
description: Each year AnimeCon holds different cosplay competitions, and this year will be no different! So, do you want to show off your incredible cosplay on a stage, but are the competitions for WCS, Euro Cosplay or the ECG not for you? Why not compete in the Fashion Show to try it out?
webDescription:
A convention is a time for many things, socializing, participating in workshops and, maybe most importantly, to wear your wonderful, self-made costume! But during this Fashion Show we invite cosplayers to do more than just walking around in the halls… Not all of you are keen on doing an entire act, or to make a spectacle, but for this show, the rules are different. This competition is the way to be able to show your cosplay to every con visitor without the stress that may come with some of the bigger competitions. A little music, a few twirls and everyone will have been able to properly gawk at you.

So do you want to do something a bit more daring? Then this is your competition.

Sign-up
You can now sign up for AnimeCon Solo and all other competitions here.

When signing up for this competition, you will in any case need to provide us with:

- Small storyboard about your act in 5-10 lines of text (If you just pose, state that you will do just that.)
- Ticket reference number
Without these, your entry will not be valid.

Not required for watching.

Restrictions
Aside from the usual rules, the following applies: 
Visitors of this specific event are allowed to take pictures of the event. All entrants need to agree to this if they want to compete in this event. A special entry for this purpose has been added to the Cosplay Competition registration form. However, it is NOT allowed, to use FLASH photography! Remember other people's personal (as well as third parties) rights will always apply, but what you do with YOUR pictures/recordings is YOUR OWN responsibility!

Rules
For cosplay weapons guidelines read the house rules/huisregels. Dutch weapons law will always apply! 
You must wear a self-made costume. 
There are no age restrictions.
There are no nationality restrictions.
You may use small props that were store bought.
You are allowed to perform an act on stage that may not exceed 90 seconds. If you just pose, 60 seconds is the max. 
Once entered, you will get a script form to fill in the details of your act. This will have to be handed in on Saturday 9th of May, 23:59h at the latest.
With your script, you will also have to provide:
- Work in Progress pictures from all parts of the costume and relevant props,
- Reference pictures,
- Any audio/video you want to use during the skit.
You may not use: Any items that can spill on the stage, like bubbles, glitter, confetti etc.
You may not use: Live fire, dry ice, live steel weapons or other things that could be a danger to yourself or others.
Stage ninjas are allowed in a small way: our staff can hand you a prop or item from backstage or press a button for you. Interaction with the cosplayers on stage is NOT allowed.
You must attend AnimeCon at least on Sunday.
Your Cosplay must be from an Anime, Manga, Game or Cartoon. It may not be a fictional character you created. 
Participating in AnimeCon Solo restricts you from entering the Eurocosplay and ECG solo preliminaries.
Questions?
If you have questions regarding the Cosplay Competition, kindly direct them to us, using the appropriate forum (Before you submit a question, please browse the forum to see if your question has already been answered) or send us an e-mail using our contact form (choose 'Cosplay Event' from the subject dropdown menu).

title: The Cow's Cavern Speakeasy
description: Our AnimeCon Speakeasy
webDescription: Extra, extra! Read all about it! Rumors of a secret speakeasy at AnimeCon Classic are spreading like wildfire! Despite the prohibition putting a ban on alcohol, some say a speakeasy bar is hidden somewhere in this venue, selling moonshine and other such drinks. The AnimeCon staff denies any such accusations, claiming they would never associate with such a thing. “Assuming that we have a speakeasy - and I'm not confirming that we do - it would indeed sell some amazing drinks,” stated Chairman Niels Viveen. He went on to say the following: “A hypothetical speakeasy would be open on Friday from 18:00 to 03:00, on Saturday from 18:00 to 03:00. It would be found underground, of course, in the lower levels of the convention. One would have to knock on the correct door and give the password, which we would have to hide on the convention grounds as well as in this very newspaper. As you can imagine, that is incredibly farfetched. Visitors absolutely cannot visit this speakeasy, unless they can, in which case AnimeCon denies any ties to this establishment.” So you heard it here first, folks! There is definitely not a secret speakeasy bar at AnimeCon Classic.

title: Exclusive Specialty Sake Tasting
rules:
• You need to show some ID to proof you are 18 years or older.
  • Must not be the designated driver.
  • Please refrain from talking during the presentation.
  • Feel free to talk when tasting the sake.

Additional information

  • As it is a tasting you do not have to finish each drink, though you are free to do so.
  • As we are concerned about our visitor's health, there is water available to drink.
  • You do not need to “clean your palate” with water between each sake, though again you are free to do so.
description: In 2009 we organized our first sake tasting in the Theaterhotel Almelo. To celebrate our return to Almelo we organize two special tastings for the connoisseurs. On Saturday we will present you with 5 top exclusive sakes.
webDescription:
Using just the simple ingredients of rice, pure water and koji (a type of yeast), brewers in Japan create a wide variety of sake. Or as they call it in Japan: Nihonshu. Add in some extra ingredients and the variety explodes.

This tour you will let you taste 5 different kinds of sake, that are all at least up to the quality level of the Grand Cru of sake: a Junmai Daiginjo. If you always liked the most expensive sake best in our tastings, this is the tasting for you!

Junmai Daiginjo is the highest grade of sake. Junmai means sakes that are created using only water, rice and koji. Daiginjo means that the rice has been polished 50% or more before fermentation. The Junmai Daiginjo's we will be enjoying are:

  • Tsukino Katsu Nigori Sparkling Junmai Daiginjo
  • Born Ginsen Junmai Daiginjo
  • L ‘Atelier du Sake Muroka Daiginjo
  • Yamato Shizuku Junmai Daiginjo
  • Heavensake Junmai Daiginjo

Your tour guide, as always, will be Simon Hofstra who has been introducing us to new sake since 2009. He gained in-depth knowledge of sake as sommelier at the Okura hotel, then brought quality sake to Dutch supermarkets working for Vinites. Currently, he is one of the powers behind sake.nl as the owner of Taste of Sake.

If you want to dive even deeper into the world of sake, you can also take one of the sake courses of the Wine & Spirit Education Trust, where you will meet Simon as instructor. He also hosts our introductory tastings in de Broodfabriek at our regular edition in June.

To give these tasting the ambiance these sake's require, we will hold the tastings in the most exclusive room in the hotel, only ever rented out to AnimeCon: de Oude Societeit. And of course the servers serve the sake in style as well!

After the tasting you will find Simon in the Ravel bar where you can order more of the sake you liked the most!

title: AMV Competition
rules:
Welcome to the rules of AnimeCon’s AMV and XMV contest! First off: time to stress about the deadlines!

* The deadline for participating in the AMV or XMV contest is Saturday September 3, 2022, 23:59:59.
If you submit your video past this deadline, you're out of luck and we advise you to try again next year. We mean it: plan ahead!

* The deadline for mended videos is Saturday September 10, 2022, 23:59:59,
This deadline is for already submitted, but non-complying videos which need some work, but only those submitted by the first deadline. 
Remember: we test and watch each video fully to make sure it works. If for some reason your video doesn't play or has other malfunctions, we will let you know as soon as possible, and you'll have until this date to send us a fixed version.

* Formats and containers: 
please stick to video codecs like H.264/5, WMV, DivX/XviD and MPEG; AAC, AC3 or PCM for audio and containers like .avi, .wmv, .mp4, .mpg or .mkv. AVCHD transport streams mixed with Dolby Digital audio (.m2t) will do nicely as well.
We will flat out refuse AMVs in closed or clunky formats, like .mov, .rm, .flv, .swf and .3gp. Be glad we don't ask for a DCP, because that's a whole other league. ;)

* The AMV contest, which you will have to attend in person, will probably be held on Saturday at Main Stage.
We will send you an e-mail with the necessary details. You as an editor will have to be there to vote for your peers' AMVs. We kindly ask you to be there about 30-45 minutes before the show starts, so we can make sure everyone’s there, explain how the system works, and do a test run. Not showing up in time without letting us know why may result in disqualification!
We have an Editors and an Audience prize for the AMV: the former is decided by the editors (that means you too), the latter will be decided by the audience.
The winners will be announced at the end of the competition, but if we have a feeling something's not right, we might decide to postpone the announcement of the final results to a later date and time at our discretion.

* The XMV is back!
You read it correctly: this AnimeCon Original event will be scheduled during AnimeCon Classic, probably on Friday evening as usual. If you want to make something sexy (straight, gay, sapphic: we don’t care), violent, or gore-y, please let your freak flag fly, and get loose. There’s only one caveat: keep it within the boundaries of Dutch Law, so no minors involved in sexual acts, for instance. Whether a video will be shown will ultimately be at the discretion of our legal team, but that will be a decision based on the laws, not on taste. (otherwise, Sander wouldn’t have had his 10-year streak, amirite?)
We have yet to decide to make it a full competition or a showing, depending on the number of participants, but we will have this event again.

* Your video needs to be an original, as in not shown in public or in other Dutch contests before. Showing to family and friends for review is fine and even encouraged. We also frown heavily on copying other people's work, so don't do that.
When in doubt, we reserve the privilege of checking with various sources whether your video is an original.
To prevent repeat performances (ie. AMVs which already have been submitted to other festivals within our country), we have an exchange agreement with those festivals. This means that your AMV and your personal details will be made available to the person responsible for their AMV-competition and in reverse.
Suffice to say that nothing else will happen to your AMV or your details; we will not make anything public other than playing the videos at our festival and announcing the winners to the world, unless you give us explicit permission to do otherwise. We'd also love to play your video at other events if the need arises.

* Your video needs to contain animation as its prime ingredient and make sure it actually has audio.
Note that we will interpret the term 'animation' loosely. If you are confident that you can make something awesome with just stills, that's fine by us, but try to make more of it than just a slide show. It's OK to use live-action or game footage as well if you like, but keep in mind that in the end, it's an animation show set to music.
If there's a great demand for a Game video show or Cosplay video show, we will be the last persons to say no to that, but we will have to see whether the number of submissions is large enough to warrant its own competition.

* We're a family show, so no pornography, gore, excessive graphical violence or blood during the AMV competition please. We have the XMV for that.
Cartoon violence is allowed. If you're in doubt whether your AMV will pass, please show us a rough version or let us know which show you're going to use and we'll advise in favour or against it. If you just send in your gory video without consulting, you'll most probably be disqualified and I'll probably make a mention of it for everybody to laugh at.

* You can put spoilers in your video.
There's no reason for us to say no to this.

* Your video's length must not exceed 3 minutes and 40 seconds.
There's a reason for that, more on that later. Your sequence must be like this: 1 seconds of silent black, 210 seconds of AMV (maximum, but doesn't need to be 210: a video that drags along is just as bad as a video that's too short), 8 silent seconds of white on black-credits to the music and animation in a readable, sans serif font, and 1 second silent black. Please don't name yourself in the credit screen; this might be of influence during judging.

* No visible logos, (fan)subs, credits, or what have you.
Just don't. If you can't use a Blu-ray or DVD source for whatever reason (often has a credit-less opening and ending as extra), at least take some time to get rid of unwanted details. If we get the feeling you just threw something together, hit the Render button and be done with it, you'll be disqualified immediately. You may put in your own subtitles or texts if you want, but let us know, and keep in mind that most AMV fans are not deaf and able to hear what the artist is singing.

* Video resolution can be between standard DVD resolution and 1920x1080p.
If you want to make it smaller, your video will probably be rejected, because counting pixels isn't everyone's hobby, and you can only upscale to a certain level before things become awkward. Square pixels are preferred; while a 1440x1080 video will play OK, we'd appreciate progressive videos all the way. We usually have a FullHD screen, so please don't put too much effort into a 4k video. 
There is no limit on file size, but be moderate. There is no need to reserve more than one gigabyte for 3 minutes of HD video. 20Mbit video streams should be more than sufficient to let you show wat you want to show, and uncompressed AVI-files will not be played.

* Aspect ratio can be 4:3 or 16:9.
Our screen is 16:9, our player output and display device will be set to 1920x1080 pixels. Our screen will be something in the range of 6 to 12 meters in diameter.
However, don't upscale your DVD source to something it's not if you don't absolutely have to; it might end up becoming ugly. Just adhere to your source material: the scaling hardware in our equipment will take care of it instead.

* Mark your file with your Ticket number (YTP---------), your initials and the title of the AMV in one uninterrupted file name (for example, mine would be YTP12345678-KS-Eat-Sleep-Rave-Repeat.m2ts).
This makes life easier for us and helps to determine which is what and to whom it belongs. Titles like Sequence01.mpg are NOT acceptable and its eligibility for participation will be determined by rolling one D6 dice. When the result is a 7, your lazily-named file will be accepted after all. 
Please put your AMV into a ZIP, 7zip or RAR-file with the same name as described and upload it to your server, or use Google Drive, Dropbox or WeTransfer.

* You need to attend the competition in person, holding a valid ticket for the festival.
We need you there to vote for the other contestants. Besides, it's more fun to see the people react to your AMV when you're there.

* Voting is done on the spot, through a custom voting system.
We built the system for the editors in-house. Very reliable, and it's been in service since 2012! We also have an online system for the audience votes.
The editors get a vote box, the audience votes through an online form. When it's time to vote, the boxes are set to receive input, the judges enter their points (0 to 99 points) and hit the pound-key (#) to enter it into the system. The boxes save the entry locally and are read out by the master system. We can see live and on the spot which votes are cast and how many points are given.
At the end of the run, we can announce the scores in mere seconds.

* Pre-judging.
If we run the risk of going past the allotted 90 minutes of the AMV event, a pre-judging will be necessary. This will be done through a small group of non-competing editors and experts in the field of video editing. They will be looking at a variety of parameters, such as story, sync, imagery and overall synergy between music and footage.
The editors that don't make it are invited to come to the show at the same time the other editors do and will fall under the same category as alumni. They are not allowed to vote, however.

* Collaborations are permitted.
We can't enforce a ban on things like this, so we won't try. However, you can only send in one AMV and we will only have one trophy for the winning AMV, unless your team manages a double whammy for both the Audience and Editors prize.

*Tips and tricks:
+ Make sure your encoding machine has computing power to spare; the average video encoder takes every last bit of processing power it can find. Professional editing software also uses your GPU when compatible. For example: Premiere recognises the nVidia CUDA-GPU and uses its processing power when it renders.
+ Make sure your project settings fit your source material in terms of frame rate, resolution, etc.
+ Despite following the specs to the letter, it's still possible to screw up because you're adamant on using PCM, while the container demands AC3/Dolby Digital. Good editing or rendering software usually helps you with this, so pay attention!
+ Interlaced video in progressive AMVs usually makes your video look like crap (jagged lines are a giveaway), so make sure you de-interlace your source material and set your output to progressive as well. Some editing software doesn't allow you to go back and change the fundamental settings of your project, so be extra careful when you set up your project.
+ Don't add black bars to your video! Video players are perfectly able to figure out which aspect ratio the video has and will add black bars when necessary.
+ Make sure your audio sounds good with a sufficient bit rate. Check this by playing it through a proper audio set instead of a set of in-ear headphones, your Bluetooth speaker with 3cm diameter and a lot of distortion, or the tiny speakers of your laptop. We will have a large, professional audio setup available during the competition which amplifies (ba-dum tshh) every flaw your audio stream has.
+ Normalize your audio and make sure the peaks do not go above -3dB, but definitely not over 0dB. Our equipment and hundreds of pairs of ears will thank you for it.
+ When you're all set and done, make sure you watch and listen to your video at least one last time before you send it in and perhaps show it to your significant other, a member of your family or a friend as well. If one of them or you sees something out of the ordinary, you can still do something about it.

Good luck, you will have fierce competition. As always, we're looking forward to seeing your creations.


---------

Dit zijn de regels voor de AnimeCon’s AMV en XMV wedstrijden!

Laten we meteen maar met het ergste beginnen: deadlines!
* De deadline voor deelname bij de AMV- of XMV-wedstrijd is 3 september 2022, 23:59:59.
Als je je video later inlevert dan bovenstaand, kun je niet meer meedoen, dus plan vooruit!

* De deadline voor aangepaste video’s is 10 september 2022, 23:59:59,
Deze geldt voor video’s die al ingeleverd zijn, maar om bepaalde redenen nog niet mee kunnen doen, omdat ze bijvoorbeeld niet aan de regels voldoen. 
We testen elke video, om te zien of hij werkt, en of de regels na worden geleefd. We laten je zo snel mogelijk weten of je video mee mag doen, en als er wat aan scheelt, heb je dus t/m deze deadline om er wat aan te doen.

* Formaten en containers. 
We houden van H.264/5, WMV, DivX/XviD en MPEG video; AAC, AC3 of PCM voor audio, en containers zoals .avi, .wmv, .mp4, .mpg of .mkv. AVCHD transport streams met Dolby Digital audio (.m2t) werkt ook goed.
We weigeren AMVs in gesloten of achterlijke formaten zoals (maar niet beperkt tot) .mov, .rm, .flv, .swf and .3gp. Wees blij dat we geen DCP-formaat vragen. ;)

* De AMV-wedstrijd, waar je bij aanwezig moet zijn, zal waarschijnlijk op zaterdag op het hoofdpodium worden gehouden.
We sturen je enkele dagen van tevoren een e-mail met de details. Jij als videomaker wordt geacht bij de wedstrijd aanwezig te zijn. Niet alleen omdat het leuk is om de reacties van het publiek te horen, maar we zetten je ook aan het werk: je moet de video’s van je tegenstanders beoordelen. We stelen het op prijs als je 30-45 minuten van tevoren aanwezig bent, zodat we het stemsysteem uit kunnen leggen en een testronde houden. Ben je er niet op tijd zonder het te laten weten, kunnen we je video diskwalificeren.
We hebben een prijs voor de beste video in de categorie Editors en Audience: de eerste categorie wordt dus bepaald door de deelnemers, de publieksprijs is precies dat.
We maken de winnaars bekend aan het eind van de competitie, maar houden ons het recht voor om de uitslag uit te stellen als we denken dat er iets niet klopt. In dat geval zullen de prijzen op een door ons te bepalen moment worden uitgereikt, bijvoorbeeld tijdens de sluitingsceremonie. 

* De XMV is terug!
Je leest het goed: de AnimeCon Original keert terug tijdens AnimeCon Classic, waarschijnlijk op vrijdag. Als je een sexy video wil maken (in welke richting dan ook), of een horrorvideo met heel veel bloed en veertig enge dooien, ga dan vooral je gang in de XMV.
Er is wel een belangrijke regel: maak ons geen medeplichtige, en zorg dat je video binnen de Nederlandse wet vertoond kan worden. Minderjarigen die seks hebben is bijvoorbeeld uitgesloten. Of we je video laten zien is uiteindelijk aan ons team van experts. Dit oordeel zal worden gebaseerd op de wet, niet op smaak, want anders had Sander geen 10 jaar op een rij z’n video’s mogen vertonen, nietwaar?
Het is op dit moment nog niet zeker of het een volledige competitie wordt, of een vertoning: dit hangt geheel van jullie af.

* Je video mag nog niet gebruikt zijn in andere competities. 
Deze vertonen aan vrienden en familie valt daar uiteraard niet onder, en juichen we alleen maar toe. Input van anderen helpt je om je video nog beter te maken. We keuren het kopiëren van andermans werk ten zeerste af, dus doe dat niet
Bij twijfel zullen we verschillende manieren aanwenden om te controleren of je video een origineel is.
Om herhalingen te voorkomen hebben we een uitwisselingsafspraak met andere festivals in Nederland. Dat houdt in dat je AMV met hen gedeeld wordt. Die gegevens worden enkel met die organisatoren gedeeld.
Verder wordt er, afgezien van het mogelijk vertonen op andere evenementen, niets gedaan met jouw video. Het delen, online zetten, of anderszins publiceren ervan is geheel aan jou.

* Je video moet voornamelijk uit animatie bestaan, en zorg ervoor dat er geluid bij zit. 
Nu zullen we de term ‘animatie’ vrij losjes hanteren. Als jij ervan overtuigd bent dat je een geweldige video kunt maken met enkel stilstaand beeld, dan mag je dat uiteraard laten zien, maar doe er wat meer mee dan enkel een diashow. Live-action beeld of video uit games mogen ook, maar uiteindelijk is het een wedstrijdje van geanimeerde beelden op muziek. Mocht er vraag zijn naar een competitie voor specifiek gamevideo’s of cosplayvideos, dan zullen we moeten bekijken of daar genoeg animo voor is.

* We maken een show die ook geschikt is voor jongere kinderen en opa en oma, dus voor de normale AMV graag geen pronografische beelden, bloederige beelden, of extreem gewelddadige beelden. Daar hebben we de XMV voor.
Zogeheten Cartoon Violence (denk hierbij aan Looney Tunes en dergelijke) is toegestaan, maar als je twijfelt, vraag het ons dan even, stuur een ruwe versie, of een omschrijving van wat je van plan bent. We zullen je dan naar eer en geweten van een antwoord voorzien. Mocht je besluiten om gewoon een smerige video in te sturen, dan is de kans groot dat we je alsnog diskwalificeren, en om je zullen lachen tijdens de competitie.

* Je video mag spoilers bevatten.
Er is geen enkele reden om dat te verbieden.

* De maximum lengte van je video is 3 minuten en 40 seconden.
Maak je video als volgt: 1 seconde zwart zonder audio, maximaal 210 seconden aan AMV (3,5 minuut, maar het mag ook korter), 8 seconden voor een dia waarin je vermeldt wat je bronmateriaal is, en eventueel een dankwoord, dis alles in een goed leesbaar font, en als laatste weer 1 seconde zwart. Vermeld niet je naam of andere hints die naar jou herleidbaar zijn: dit kan de jurering beïnvloeden.

* Geen logos, (fan)subs, credits, of iets in die geest.
Gewoon niet doen. Als je geen Blu-ray of DVD als bron kunt gebruiken, doe dan tenminste wat moeite om ongewenste details weg te halen. Als we denken dat je gewoon wat in elkaar hebt gegooid en gerenderd, zullen we je zeer waarschijnlijk gewoon diskwalificeren.
Je mag wel zelf ondertiteling of andere teksten in je video  toevoegen, maar weet wel dat de meeste mensen die naar een AMV-competitie kijken, niet doof zijn, en prima kunnen horen wat er gezongen wordt.

* We raden aan om de resolutie van je video tussen DVD resolutie en 1920x1080p te houden.
Kleiner dan DVD-resolutie zullen we waarschijnlijk weigeren, omdat we niet zo van pixels tellen houden. Video opschalen werkt ook maar tot een bepaalde hoeveelheid pixels. We houden van vierkante pixels: 1440x1080 zal waarschijnlijk prima spelen, maar een Progressive videobestand vinden we leuker. We zullen een FullHD videoscherm gebruiken, dus stop niet teveel moeite in een 4k video.
We hebben geen limiet op de bestandsgrootte, maar houd er rekening mee dat meer dan 1GB voor 3 minuten video overkill is. Een videostream van 20Mbit is meer dan genoeg om te laten zien wat je wil laten zien. Ongecomprimeerde AVI-bestanden zullen we niet accepteren.

* De beeldverhouding kun je op 4:3 of 16:9 houden.
Ons scherm is 16:9, en naar verwachting een meter of 6 tot 8 breed, de output van de videospeler zetten we op 1920x1080 pixels. 
We raden je af om lage-resolutie bronnen op te schalen naar iets groters, tenzij je geen andere keuze hebt. Houd je aan je bronmateriaal, en stem je video daarop af. Onze videospeler zoekt wel uit hoe het beste te schalen.

* Zorg dat je in de bestandsnaam je Ticketnummer (YTP---------), je initialen, en de titel van je video (als voorbeeld zou de mijne dan YTP12345678-KS-Eat-Sleep-Rave-Repeat.m2ts worden).
Dat maakt mijn leven een stuk makkelijker, omdat ik dan kan zien wiens video ik aan het bekijken ben. Namen als  Sequence01.mpg zijn onacceptabel, en de acceptatie van een dergelijk bestand wordt bepaald door het rollen met een D6-dobbelsteen. Als ik dan een 7 gooi, wordt hij alsnog geaccepteerd.
 Stop je video in een ZIP, 7zip of RAR-bestand, met dezelfde naam als hierboven beschreven en stuur die dan op via je eigen server, of via Google Drive, Dropbox of WeTransfer.

* We zien graag dat je bij de competitie zelf aanwezig bent, met een geldig ticket.
We hebben je nodig voor het stemmen op de andere video’s. Daarbij is het gewoon leuker om live te horen wat mensen van je creatie vinden.

* Stemmen doen we dus tijdens het event, middels een op maat gemaakt stemsysteem.
We hebben het systeem in 2012 zelf ontworpen en gebouwd, met een aantal veiligheidjes om meer zekerheid te hebben. Er is ook een online stemsysteem voor de publieksjury.
Je krijgt een stemkastje. Op het moment dat er gestemd moet worden, krijgen de kastjes een signaal, waarna je je punten in kunt vullen (1 tot 99 punten) en op het hekje drukken om je stem definitief te maken. Het kastje slaat de gegeven score op, en worden uitgelezen door de server. We kunnen live zien welke scores gegeven worden en door wie.
Aan het eind weten we binnen enkele seconden wie er gewonnen heeft

* Voorselectie.
Als het erop lijkt dat het event langer gaat duren dan de 90 minuten die we normaliter ervoor reserveren, dan zullen we een voorselectie moeten maken. Deze voorselectie zal gedaan worden door een aantal videomakers die niet mee zullen doen met de wedstrijd, en de ingezonden video’s zullen beoordelen op verhaal, synchronisatie, gebruik van beelden, en hoe goed de muziek en beelden bij elkaar passen.
De editors die hierbij afvallen, zullen een uitnodiging krijgen om ook eerder bij de show aanwezig te zijn, en vallen in de alumnus-categorie. Zij zullen niet mee kunnen stemmen voor de Editor-prijs.

* Samenwerkingen zijn toegestaan.
We kunnen dit eenvoudigweg niet verbieden, dus dat gaan we ook niet proberen. Jullie kunnen echter maar één AMV inzenden, en er zal ook maar één trofee beschikbaar zijn, tenzij het project beide prijzen in de wacht weet te slepen.

*Tips en trucs:
+ Zorg dat je computer voldoende rekenkracht heeft; de gemiddelde video-encoder wil elk spoortje processorkracht gebruiken die beschikbaar is. Professionele bewerkingssoftware is ook in staat om de GPU van je machine in te zetten om te renderen: Premiere herkent de nVidia CUDA-GPU, en gebruikt deze om sneller te rekenen.
+ Zorg dat je project settings bij je bronmateriaal passen waar het om framerate, resolutie, en dergelijke gaat. 
+ Het is nog steeds mogelijk om je video te verknoeien, omdat je bijvoorbeeld PCM audio wil gebruiken, terwijl de gebruikte container vraagt om AC3. Goede software wijst je hierop, dus let goed op! 
+ Interlaced video in progressive AMVs laten je video er vaak verschrikkelijk uitzien: kartelrandjes worden ineens zichtbaar, dus zorg dat je je bronmateriaal de-interlacet, en je output ook op progressive zet. Sommige videobewerkingsprogramma’s staan niet toe dat je je de basisinstellingen van je project aanpast, dus zorg voor een goede basis. 
+ Voeg geen zwarte balken toe aan je video! Videospelers doen dat zelf, daar hebben ze jou niet voor nodig. 
+ Zorg dat je audio goed klinkt, en gebruik een hoge bit rate. Controleer dit door je video aft e spelen op een wat grotere installatie, in plaats van een Bluetoothspeaker van 5 euro. We hebben een grote, professionele geluidsset die elke fout versterkt. 
+ Normaliseer je audio, en zorg dat de pieken niet harder gaan dan -3dB, maar zeker niet de 0dB raken. Onze apparatuur en honderden oren zullen je dankbaar zijn.
+ Als alles klaar is, speel je video nog een keer af voordat je hem instuurt. Kijk er bij voorkeur met anderen naar, zodat die wellicht nog een foutje kunnen zien.


We wensen je veel geluk: de concurrentie is groot. We kijken uit naar je creatie.
description: As every year, the AMV competition is a regular part of our show and 2022's edition is no exception. If you want to join the competition, check out our site for sign-up information!
webDescription: AMV stands for Animated Music Video. AMVs can tell a story, make you laugh or cry, act as a promotion for a certain series... Or they can be just lovely to watch - to see a spectacle of images and music brought together by a fan or a group of fans. As every year, the AMV competition is a regular part of our show and 2022's edition will be no exception. Great works of art have passed the competition in previous years and it's a real treat seeing the videos people made.
prizes:
Anime 2022 AMV Editors
Anime 2022 AMV Audience
ticketsInfo:
One steward at door 1 with a list
AMV Editors and Audience Voters are allowed early access. Editors are on a list, Audience Voters will get a special ticket handed.
Two tech for setting up
Three tech for running the show
Kaj for presenting the show (Sander van den Boogaart is backup)

title: Weeb Lingo
description: Weeb Lingo is back once again, by popular demand!
webDescription:
This time, Douglas and Erika will be jazzing up AnimeCon's Sunday with the Netherlands' most recognizable game show! Keen excitement, entertainment and fun, with the return of themed rounds! Are you a big palooka or a wisehead? The Weeb Lingo team will be putting the screws on a lucky few from the audience and only those who are experts on these themes will become true Weeb Lingo Masters! So come on down and let's have a good time!

Deze keer zullen Douglas en Erika AnimeCon's zondag opfleuren met Nederlands meest herkenbare spelshow! Grote spanning, entertainment en plezier, met de terugkeer van themarondes! Ben je een grote palooka of een wijsneus? Het Weeb Lingo-team zal een paar gelukkigen uit het publiek plukken en alleen degenen die experts zijn in deze thema's zullen echte Weeb Lingo-meesters worden! Dus kom langs en laten we een leuke tijd hebben!
ticketsInfo:
Douglas Pluylaar
dougurasu@gmail.com

Nick Valk
nick.valk@live.nl

title: Nippon Bingo
description: Here you can play our anime-themed bingo and win fun prizes!
webDescription:
Tired after enjoying the festival grounds? Just want to sit down and relax, yet still want to have some fun? Then join our Nippon Bingo!

Do you know the long history of Bingo? Or should we say… Beano? Well, in the 1850s, several educational lotto games entered the German toys market. The lotto games purpose was to teach children how to spell words, how to multiply numbers, etc. By 1920s, a similar version to the lotto game, known as beano was popular at county fairs throughout the US. In beano, the players placed beans on their cards to mark the called out number. The first player who completed a full row on his card, used to yell out "Beano!", until one night in December 1929, when a New Yorker toys salesperson by the name of Edwin S. Lowe visited a country fair outside Jacksonville, Georgia. Lowe was the one who decided to develop a new game that would be called Bingo, which was really just the same as Beano, except minus the beans. That's why this Roaring Twenties-themed convention would be incomplete without Bingo!

JCES Kinjin is the Japanese culture association for students in Eindhoven. At conventions, we do all kinds of fun activities, such as Jan Ken Pon (our own more interesting version of Paper Scissors Rock), Cards Against Anime (Cards Against Humanity with anime-themed cards), the Evil Otaku Quiz (a quiz where we ask questions about the most random facts of current and older anime and manga) and Nippon Bingo (an anime-themed bingo event). If you want to know more about us, then you can visit us on our website! ((https://kinjin.nl/))

Moe na het genieten van het festivalterrein? Wil je gewoon lekker zitten en ontspannen, maar toch plezier maken? Doe dan mee met onze Nippon Bingo!

Ken jij de lange geschiedenis van Bingo? Of… Beano? Welnu, in de jaren 1850 kwamen verschillende educatieve lottospellen op de Duitse speelgoedmarkt. Het doel van de lottospellen was om kinderen te leren woorden te spellen, getallen te vermenigvuldigen, enz. Tegen de jaren 1920 was een soortgelijke versie van het lottospel, bekend als beano, populair op kermissen in de VS. In beano plaatsten de spelers bonen op hun kaarten om het opgeroepen nummer te markeren. De eerste speler die een volledige rij op zijn kaart voltooide, schreeuwde "Beano!", tot op een avond in december 1929, toen een speelgoedverkoper uit New York, genaamd Edwin S. Lowe, een plattelandsbeurs buiten Jacksonville, Georgia bezocht. Lowe was degene die besloot een nieuw spel te ontwikkelen dat Bingo zou gaan heten, dat eigenlijk hetzelfde was als Beano, behalve de bonen. Daarom is deze conventie met het thema Roaring Twenties niet compleet zonder Bingo!

JCES Kinjin is de Japanse cultuurvereniging voor studenten in Eindhoven. Op conventies doen we allerlei leuke activiteiten, zoals Jan Ken Pon (onze eigen interessantere versie van Paper Scissors Rock), Cards Against Anime (Cards Against Humanity met kaarten met anime-thema), de Evil Otaku Quiz (een quiz waarbij we stellen vragen over de meest willekeurige feiten van huidige en oudere anime en manga) en Nippon Bingo (een bingo-evenement met een anime-thema). Als je meer over ons wilt weten, kun je ons bezoeken op onze website! ((https://kinjin.nl/))
prizes: 1 hoofdprijs en een stuk of vijf kleine prijsjes voor verschillende winnaars
